Take the cask to the Circators.
Llevar el tonel a los circatores.
Find out Jodok’s role in the nocturnal drinking bouts.
Descubrir el papel de Jodok en las borracheras nocturnas.
Talk about the Circators with Lucas.
Hablar con Lucas de los circatores.
Report the boozing to the Prior.
Informar al prior de que se consume alcohol.
Talk to Jodok about the wine for the Circators.
Hablar con Jodok sobre el vino de los circatores.
Find out what’s going on in the cellars.
Descubrir lo que pasa en la bodega.
Sit down at the table with the monks.
Sentarse en la mesa con los monjes.
Go and meet Jodok in the evening in the monastery garden.
Reunirte con Jodok esta noche, en el jardín del monasterio.
Steal the monastery keys from the Prior.
Robar al prior las llaves del monasterio.
Talk to brother Cellarius - he might be able to get a few useful things.
Hablad con el hermano Cellarius. Podría conseguiros algo útil.
Find out what the Circators did to Lucas.
Descubrir lo que los circatores le hicieron a Lucas.
Open the portcullis to the outer bailey, so the reinforcements can get in.
Abrir el rastrillo que da al patio de armas, para que puedan entrar los refuerzos.
Occupy the outer bailey and prepare the ground for infiltration into the castle.
Ocupar el patio de armas y preparar el campo para infiltrarse en el castillo.
Get the potions some other way.
Conseguir las pociones de otra manera.
Find a priest willing to go to Talmberg
Buscar un sacerdote dispuesto a ir a Talmberk.
Find a physician from the monastery to come to Talmberg
Buscar un medicus en el monasterio para que vaya a Talmberk.
Tell the quartermaster to send someone for pitch.
Decirle al intendente que envíe a alguien a por brea.
Ask around the camps if anyone needs help.
Preguntar en el campamento por si alguien necesita ayuda.
Persuade the sawbones from the monastery to come to Talmberg.
Persuadir al cirujano del monasterio para que vaya a Talmberk.
Talk to Sir Divish and prepare for the attack.
Hablar con sir Divish y prepararse para el asalto.
Wait until the trebuchet is finished.
Esperar a que se finalice el trabuquete.
Go and watch the trebuchet test.
Ir a ver la prueba del trabuquete.
Tell Captain Robard about the camps.
Hablarle al capitán Robard acerca de los campamentos.
There’s not much meat in the camps - I could go and get some.
En los campamentos no hay mucha carne. Podría ir a buscar más.
The camp is out of beer - I need to ask around the local taverns for some.
El campamento no tiene cerveza. Debería preguntar en las tabernas locales para conseguir más.
Tell the quartermaster about the beer.
Hablar al intendente sobre la cerveza.
Find out if some herbalist could brew up something to fend off sleep.
Buscar un herborista que pueda crear algo capaz de evitar el sueño.
Wait until the potion is brewed.
Esperar a que se elabore la poción.
Take the potion back to the encampment
Ask the nearby charcoal-burners if they have any pitch.
Preguntar a los carboneros cercanos si tienen algo de brea.
Get the brewed potion from the herb-woman.
Ir a buscar la poción de la herborista.
Take the pitch to the quartermaster at the encampment by the quarry.
Llevar la brea al intendente del campamento que hay en la cantera.
Find Konrad Kyeser at the Sasau monastery.
Find Konrad Kyeser at the Sasau monastery.
Arrange for Konrad to leave the construction site and head for Talmberg.
Disponerlo todo para que Konrad deje el lugar de construcción y se dirija a Talmberk.
Robar la comisión de servicio del maestro constructor Karel.
Show the stolen commission to Konrad.
Mostrar la comisión robada a Konrad.
Get the commission to the scribe.
Conseguir la autorización de manos del escriba.
Make sure Karel is short of money for wages.
Asegurarse de que Karel se queda sin dinero para sueldos.
Show the forgery to Master Builder Karel.
Mostrar la falsificación al maestro constructor Karel.
Decidle a Konrad que puede partir.
Watch out for the assassin at midnight.
Vigilar por si aparecen asesinos a medianoche.
Watch out for the assassin at midnight.
Vigilar por si aparecen asesinos a medianoche.
Pick up the forged document from the scribe.
Recoger los documentos de manos del escriba.
Contarle a Feyfar acerca de Konrad.
Find Konrad Kyeser at the Sasau monastery.
Buscar a Konrad Kyeser en el monasterio de Sázava.
Find Konrad Kyeser at the Sasau monastery.
Buscar a Konrad Kyeser en el monasterio de Sázava.
Find out from Sir Divish what role you have in defence.
Que sir Divish me explique cuál será el papel a asumir en la defensa.
When you're ready, go to the battleground.
Ir al campo de batalla en cuanto todo esté preparado.
I came to the camp, the companies split up and everyone goes to battle
He venido al campamento, las compañías se han dividido y todos van a la batalla
The defence is done, now for Erik
La defensa está terminada. Ahora, a por Erik.
Go quickly and help defend the trebuchet!
¡Ir rápido a ayudar en la defensa del trabuquete!
Join the briefing in the tent.
Unirse a la reunión de la tienda.
Wait until the two-day bombardment is finished.
Esperar a que el finalicen los dos días de bombardeo.
Talk to Sir Divish once you're ready.
Hablar con sir Divish una vez listo.
Get to the tower and rescue Lady Stephanie!
Ir a la torre y rescatar a lady Stephanie.
Ride with Sir Hans to meet your father.
Cabalgar con sir Hans para reunirte con tu padre.
Go to Talmberg to give news of the attack to Divish.
Ir a Talmberk para llevar a Divish las noticias del ataque.
Iniciar el asalto sigiloso de retaguardia
Take Robard and his men to the dung heap by the ramparts.
Llevar a Robard y a sus hombres al montón de basura que hay junto a las defensas.
Advance across the burnt ground and secure it.
Avanzar a través del terreno quemado y asegurarlo.
Secure the first part of the scorched encampment.
Asegurar la primera parte del campamento abrasado.
Secure the centre of the scorched encampment.
Asegurar la parte central del campamento abrasado.
Secure the last part of the scorched encampment.
Asegurar la última parte del campamento abrasado.
Lead Captain Robard and his men to the breach in the fortifications.
Dirigir al capitán Robard y a sus hombres a la grieta en las fortificaciones.
Take the letter to Sir Hanush.
Llevar la carta a sir Hanush.
Ir a ver al capitán Bernard.
Defeat the bandits once and for all.
Derrotar a los bandidos de una vez por todas.
Go to the armoury for your kit.
Ir a la armería a por el equipo.
Find out what happened to the captive.
Descubrir qué le ha pasado al cautivo.
Wait and see if the remedy works.
Esperar a ver si el remedio funciona.
Find out what happened to Matthias.
Descubrir qué le ha pasado a Matthias.
Go to the hall of the Upper Castle.
Ir al salón del castillo mayor.
Take the captive to Rattay jail.
Llevar al cautivo a la cárcel de Rataje.
Go and report to Sir Radzig at the lookout point by Talmberg.
Ir a despachar con sir Radzig en el puesto de vigilancia de Talmberk.
Henry found information and has to go to Sir Radzig.
Henry ha descubierto información y ha de comunicársela a sir Radzig.
Go to the Upper Castle during the day to meet Margrave Jobst.
Ir al castillo mayor, durante el día, para reunirse con el margrave Jobst.
Wait until Sir Hans Capon's amorous adventure has reached a conclusion.
Esperar a que la aventura amorosa de sir Hans Capon concluya.
Wait until Capon arrives at the camp.
Esperar hasta que Capon llegue al campamento.
Pick up the letter from Margrave Jobst.
Recoger la carta de manos del margrave Jobst.
Speak with Lord Capon in the courtyard.
Hablar con lord Capon en el patio.
Find out where Sir Hans Capon has ridden off to.
Descubrir hacia dónde ha partido sir Hans Capon.
Get rid of the guardian so you can speak to Karl in private.
Librarse del ayo para poder hablar con Karl en privado.
Talk to the young man who's supposed to enter the monastery.
Hablar con el joven que parece que va a entrar en el monasterio.
Jugar a los dados con Manfred.
Steal the writ from the guardian.
Go with the writ to the monastery porter.
Ir con el escrito al portero del monasterio.
It's been long enough. There should be a new porter at the monastery by now.
Ya ha pasado tiempo suficiente. A estas alturas ya debería haber un nuevo portero en el monasterio.
Enter the monastery as a novice.
Entrar en el monasterio como novicio.
Go with the writ to the monastery porter.
Ir con el escrito al portero del monasterio.
Tell Sir Radzig what the bandits want you to do.
Contarle a sir Radzig lo que los bandidos quieren que haga.
Get out of the castle with Capon.
Get out of the castle with Capon.
Discuss what to do next with Sir Hans.
Debatir qué hacer a continuación con sir Hans.
Find Sir Radzig and Lady Stephanie.
Buscar a sir Radzig y a lady Stephanie.
Eliminate the guards at the gate.
Eliminar a los guardias de la puerta.
Get out of the castle with Capon.
Wait until the sentries are taken out.
Esperar a que liquiden a los centinelas.
Go and see Captain Robard once you're ready.
Cuando estéis listo, id a ver al capitán Robard.
Save at the end of the quest
Guardado al final de la misión
Find the pages of the torn-up book.
Buscar las páginas del libro rasgado.
Find the pages of the torn-up book. 1/15
Find the pages of the torn-up book. 1/15
Find the pages of the torn-up book. 2/15
Find the pages of the torn-up book. 2/15
Find the pages of the torn-up book. 3/15
Find the pages of the torn-up book. 3/15
Find the pages of the torn-up book. 4/15
Find the pages of the torn-up book. 4/15
Find the pages of the torn-up book. 5/15
Find the pages of the torn-up book. 5/15
Find the pages of the torn-up book. 6/15
Find the pages of the torn-up book. 6/15
Find the pages of the torn-up book. 7/15
Find the pages of the torn-up book. 7/15
Steal the forbidden book at night.
Robar el libro prohibido, de noche.
Get the key to the cabinet containing the forbidden books.
Conseguir la llave del armario que contiene el libro prohibido.
Find the records of the novices.
Buscar los registros de los novicios.
Unlock the cabinet containing the forbidden books.
Abrir la cerradura del armario que contiene los libros prohibidos.
Encontrar los registros de los novicios.
Find the other footpads from Neuhof.
Encontrar a los otros bandoleros de Neuhof.
Find out where Runt's gang is encamped.
Descubrir dónde acampa la banda de Tapón.
Infiltrarse en el campamento de bandoleros.
Find out who's behind the bandits' activities.
Descubrir quién está tras las actividades de los bandoleros.
Find out where the counterfeit coin is coming from.
Descubrir de dónde viene el dinero falso.
Try to find out from the recruiters who's behind the counterfeiting.
Intentar que los reclutadores me confíen quién está detrás las falsificaciones.
Join in the battle for Vranik and get your father's sword back
Unirse a la batalla de Vraník y recuperar la espada de padre.
Help the lords to recapture Talmberg.
Ayudar a los señores a recapturar Talmberk.
Help the lords to recapture Talmberg.
Ayudar a los señores a recapturar Talmberk.
Find out how to get your father's sword back.
Descubrir cómo recuperar la espada de padre.
Find Markvart von Aulitz and avenge your parents.
Encontrar a Markvart von Aulitz y vengar a tus padres.
Go to Neuhof, where Runt was seen.
Ir a Neuhof, donde se ha visto a Tapón.
Make the Circators stop their cruelty to Novice Lucas.
Conseguir que los circatores dejen de tratar con tanta crueldad al novicio Lucas.
Go back to Lucas and tell him his trials are over.
Volver con Lucas y decirle que sus tribulaciones han terminado.
Reporting the Circators to the Prior.
Informar al prior sobre los circatores.
Lucas was told that the Circators were reported.
Se le ha dicho a Lucas que se ha informado sobre los circatores.
Find a clue leading to the bandits' encampment.
Encontrar una pista que lleve al campamento de los bandidos.
Try and get your own equipment back.
Ask around and try to find the bandits' encampment.
Preguntar e intentar encontrar el campamento de los bandidos.
Report to Sir Radzig and Sir Hanush on the investigation.
Informar de los resultados de la investigación a sir Radzig y sir Hanush.
Go to the agreed place in the swamp by Sasau.
Ir al lugar acordado en el pantano de Sázava.
Go to Vranik and find out the foe's numbers and plans.
Ir a Vraník y descubrir el número de enemigos y sus planes.
Report to Erik in the camp
Presentarme ante Erik, en el campamento.
Scout out the camp and the enemy forces.
Explorar el campamento y las fuerzas enemigas.
Go and see Combat Master Vanyek.
Ir a ver a Vanyek, el maestro de combate.
Light a fire as a signal to the bandits.
Enseñar un fuego como señal para los bandidos.
Find out which one of the novices is Pious.
Descubrir cuál de los novicios es Pío.
Go back to Antonius with everything.
Volver junto a Antonius con todo.
Entregar a Pío a la justicia.
Sneak back into the monastery and kill Pious.
Sneak back into the monastery and kill Pious.
Right after evening mass, meet with Pious in the dormitory.
Después de la misa, reunirse con Pío en el dormitorio.
Go back to see the bandits.
Ir a ver a los bandoleros.
Wait until the blood arrives next day.
Esperar a que la sangre llegue al día siguiente.
Bring the bandits proof that you completed your mission.
Llevar a los bandidos la prueba de haber completado la misión.
Go with the other monks to the courtyard.
Ir al patio con el resto de los monjes.
Get a piece of the remains of Saint Procopius for Urban.
Conseguir un trozo de los restos de san Procopio para Urban.
Llevar a cabo el entrenamiento de Bernard.
Follow Bernard to the shooting range.
Seguir a Bernard al campo de tiro.
Realizar el entrenamiento de tiro con arco.
Compete with Hans Capon in archery.
Competir con Hans Capon en tiro con arco.
Compete with Hans Capon in archery - win.
Competir con Hans Capon en tiro con arco. - victoria
Compete with Sir Hans Capon in archery. - lose
Competir con Hans Capon en tiro con arco. - derrota
Combatir con espada con Hans Capon.
Swordfight with Sir Hans Capon. - win
Combate de espada con Hans Capon. - victoria
Swordfight with Sir Hans Capon. - lose
Combate de espada con Hans Capon. - derrota
Go to the training ground and talk to Captain Bernard.
Ir al campo de entrenamiento y hablar con el capitán Bernard.
Wait for Bernard at the training ground.
Esperar a Bernard en el campo de entrenamiento.
Ir a por vuestro caballo en el establo.
Autoguardar al inicio de la persecución
Go with Sir Robard to the kitchen.
Ir a la cocina con sir Robard.
Go to the battlements via the gateway stairs.
Ir a las almenas por las escaleras de la puerta.
Take the torch from the table.
Tomar la antorcha de la mesa.
Flee the castle and get to Skalitz.
Huir del castillo e ir a Skalice.
Go to the courtyard lodge and sleep there until morning.
Ir al pabellón del patio y dormid allí hasta la mañana.
Guardar después de la sorpresa temprana
Go to the battlements and talk to Captain Robard.
Ir a las almenas y hablar con el capitán Robard.
Go to the battlements of the outer bailey.
Ir a las almenas del patio de armas.
Bury your loved ones in Skalitz.
Enterrar a tus seres queridos en Skalice.
Help Theresa get away from her attackers.
Ayudar a Theresa a escapar de sus atacantes.
Get Talmberg armour from the guardhouse above the gate.
Obtener armadura de Talmberk en la casa del guardia que está sobre la puerta.
Dig a grave under the linden tree and bury your parents.
Excavar una tumba bajo el tilo y enterrar a tus padres.
Find out who led the raid on Skalitz and avenge your family.
Encontrar al jefe del asalto a Skalice y vengar a tu familia.
Go to Pirkstein to see Sir Radzig.
Ir a Pirkštejn a ver a sir Radzig.
Get your things from the trunk.
Recuperar las posesiones que están en el baúl.
Seguir a los hombres hasta Neuhof.
Find out where the raiders went.
Explore the area to the north of the farm.
Explorar la zona al norte de la granja.
Explore the clearing in the woods.
Find the owner of the hoofpick from Neuhof.
Encontrar al propietario del limpiacascos, en Neuhof.
Find out from Jakub where Ginger could have fled.
Preguntar a Jakub dónde puede haber huido Panocha.
Go and report to Captain Bernard in the courtyard.
Ir a informar al capitán Bernard, en el patio.
Patio de armas de castillo mayor de Rataje
Upper Castle in Rattay, the Great Hall
Castillo mayor de Rataje, Gran Salón
Claro en el bosque de Neuhof
Segundo patio de armas de Neuhof
Campamento oeste de bandidos de Sázava
Campamento de verdugo de Kutná Hora
Campamento del tesoro de los soldados
Ruin on Hill with view of Sasau
Ruinas en colina con vista de Sázava
I confronted Magda with her father, things got a little out of hand and now Wolfram is dead. I'd better go and tell Woyzeck what happened.
I confronted Magda with her father, things got a little out of hand and now Wolfram is dead. I'd better go and tell Woyzeck what happened.
Andrew confirmed our suspicions. He says there was some charcoal-burner from Rovna hanging around who tried to sell him a silver cross on a red ribbon.
Andrew ha confirmado nuestras sospechas. Dice que pasó por allí un carbonero de Rovná que intentó venderle una cruz de plata con una cinta roja.

I should ask Andrew about that thief. I don't suppose he knows every last crook in the area, but he might know someone who knows more. Otherwise, I'll have to go round all the charcoal-burners in the vicinity of Skalitz and search for... a kettle.

Debería preguntar a Andrew acerca del ladrón. No creo que vaya a conocer a todos los maleantes de la zona, pero quizá conozca a alguien que sepa más. Si no, tendré que ir a visitar a todos los carboneros de las cercanías de Skalice y buscar... una tetera.
I know Andrew put this job my way to make some easy coin, but shouldn't I give something back to Adam? At least a bit.
Sé que Andrew me informó de este trabajo para ganar un dinero fácil, ¿pero no debería darle algo a Adam? Al menos un poco.
Adam died. His worldly concerns are over.
Adam murió. Sus mundanas preocupaciones se han terminado.
Adam will be happy if I can find the rest of his coin. Everyone here would be glad to get over this misfortune.
Adam estará contento si consigo encontrar el resto de su dinero. Aquí todos estarían felices de salir de su infortunio.
I got the scribe embrocation for his knee trouble and he was willing to help me.
Conseguí el linimento para los problemas de rodilla del escriba y accedió a ayudarme.
The scribe might have been willing to help me, if he weren't suffering so badly with his knee trouble. Embrocation is a pretty straightforward thing - I can either buy it or brew it myself.
Puede que el escriba estuviera dispuesto a ayudarme, si no lo estuviera pasando tan mal con sus problemas de rodilla. El linimento es algo bastante sencillo. Puedo comprarlo o elaborarlo yo mismo.
I have to get a pitcher of Sylvan red from Sir Hanush's private archive. I doubt they'll let me into the Rattay Rathaus without question, especially at this hour and in this state!

Tengo que hacerme con algo de tinto sylvano de la reserva privada de sir Hanush. A estas horas y de esta guisa, ¡dudo que me vayan a dejar entrar en la Casa Consistorial de Rataje sin hacer muchas preguntas!
I killed Wolfram Pruda. Now Woyzeck can be at ease.
I killed Wolfram Pruda. Now Woyzeck can be at ease.
If I'm not to kill the unborn child, there's only one other option: to kill Magda's father, Wolfram.
If I'm not to kill the unborn child, there's only one other option: to kill Magda's father, Wolfram.

I went to bed, wishing with all my heart that everything that happened might have been no more than a bad dream, that I would wake at home to Father hammering on his anvil and Mother humming while she cooked - that everything would be like it was before.

Quiero irme a la cama. Y deseo con todo mi corazón que todo lo acontecido no fuera sino un mal sueño, poder despertarme en casa, con padre golpeando su yunque y madre tatareando mientras cocina... que todo volviera a ser como era.
I wish everything that happened today had just been a bad dream, and that I'll wake at home to the sound of Father hammering on his anvil and Mother humming while she cooks.
Ojalá todo lo acontecido hoy fuera un mal sueño y pudiera despertarme en casa, con padre golpeando su yunque y madre tatareando mientras cocina.
Elishka's relatives live near the small fishpond east of Rattay.
Los parientes de Elishka viven cerca de un estanque, al este de Rataje.
In the end the bright sunlight woke me, with a little help from my parents. I went to help Father in the forge, as I'd promised him the day before. But first he wanted me to run some errands for him.

Al final la brillante luz del sol me despertó, con algo de ayuda de mis padres. Fui a ayudar a padre en la forja, tal y como le había prometido el día anterior. Pero antes quería que me ocupara de unos recados.
I have to go to Father - I promised I'd help him with his work.
Debo ir con padre... Le prometí ayudarlo con su faena.
In order to help Hermann, I first had to find out at the Bailiff's what crimes the reprobates had been sentenced to death for. And it turned out they were a fine pack of scoundrels!
Para ayudar a Hermann, primero tuve que averiguar del merino por qué crímenes habían sido sentenciados los forajidos a muerte. ¡Y resultó que eran un puñado de sabandijas!
The Bailiff should know what the reprobates have been convicted of. Then I can find their crimes in the Black Chronicle and see what the usual sentence is.
El merino debería saber por qué crímenes han condenado a esos maleantes. Cuando los descubra, debería poder buscarlos en La crónica negra y ver cuál es la sentencia habitual en esos casos.
Once I knew the crimes, I could find out the appropriate punishments from the Black Chronicle.
Una vez conocí sus crímenes, pude encontrar en La crónica negra los castigos que les correspondían.

I can find out in the Black Chronicle which punishments fit which crimes and then compare them with the Bailiff's testimony about the reprobates. Then I'll know how to sabotage the executions. So, quickly to the Black Chronicle!

Puedo buscar en La crónica negra el castigo adecuado para los crímenes y compararlos con lo dicho por el merino sobre esos canallas. Entonces sabré cómo sabotear las ejecuciones. ¡Rápido pues, a La crónica negra!

In the kitchen Captain Robard introduced me to the lady of the castle, Lady Stephanie, and the cook, Bozhena, who served me some food. They also offered me a place to sleep in the bedchamber of the lodge in the courtyard.

Ya en la cocina, el capitán Robard me ha presentado a la dama del castillo: lady Stephanie, y a la cocinera, Bozhena, que me ha servido algo de comida. También me han ofrecido un sitio en los dormitorios del pabellón del patio, para que descanse.
I should go with him, since I don't know where the castle kitchen is.
Debería ir con él, porque no sé dónde está la cocina del castillo.
Executioner Hermann was delighted with the outcome of the sabotaged executions, and I was glad I could help him.
El verdugo Hermann ha quedado encantado con el resultado de las ejecuciones saboteadas. Y yo también, por haber podido ayudarle.
The executions went according to plan. That is to say, our plan. I'd better go and tell Hermann how it all went down.
Las ejecuciones han ido según lo planeado. Lo planeado por nosotros. Será mejor que vaya a contarle a Hermann como ha ido todo.
No rest for the wicked! Now the young Lord wanted me to pick flowers for Klara the bathmaid. Surprisingly, I managed it.
¡No hay paz para los malvados! Ahora el joven señor quería que recogiera flores para Klara, la moza de los baños. Sorprendentemente, lo conseguí.
Here we go again! Now Lord Capon wants me to get a bouquet for the bathhouse wench. I have to pick dandelions, sage, poppies and roses.
¡De nuevo en la rueda! Ahora lord Capon quiere que le consiga un ramo para la moza de la casa de baños. Tengo que recoger dientes de león, salvia, amapolas y rosas.

There was only Deutsch's wife to stop us from avenging the insult to our good King, with the aid of a big pile of manure. Getting her out of the way was no big problem though, so soon we could get down to redecorating Deutsch's house.

Solo la esposa de Tudesco se interponía en nuestra misión de vengar los insultos a nuestro buen rey con la ayuda de algo de estiércol. Pero no fue tarea difícil sacarla de la casa, así que pronto podremos redecorar la casa de Tudesco.
We can't get down to redecorating Deutsch's house as long as his wife's around. We'll have to lure her away somehow. And since my friends say I'm the cleverest one, of course the job falls to me.

No podemos redecorar la casa de Tudesco mientras su esposa esté por allí. Tenemos que hacer que se vaya, de alguna manera. Y como mis amigos dicen que soy el más sagaz, estaba claro que sería cosa mía.

Forging with Father was great. We finished the sword for Sir Radzig. Blacksmithing is a wonderful trade that folk need, not just on account of swords, but also everyday things like, for example, the nails we made for the miller, whose daughter Theresa came to collect them.

Forjar con padre ha sido estupendo. Acabamos la espada para sir Radzig. La herrería es un oficio maravilloso, algo necesario, pero no solo para hacer espadas, sino también cosas de uso cotidiano, como los clavos que hicimos para el molinero y que su hija, Theresa, vino a recoger.

The forging was going nicely when we were interrupted by Theresa, the miller's young daughter, who came to pick up some nails for her father. I've got to go into the house and get them from the trunk.
La forja iba bien hasta que nos ha interrumpido Theresa, la joven hija del molinero, que vino a recoger unos clavos. Entré en la casa y los cogí del baúl.

Everyone in the castle was on the battlements anticipating the worst - Sigismund's army. But to everyone's astonishment it turned out to be Sir Radzig and all the remaining survivors from Skalitz. What was even more surprising is that they escaped the siege without a fight. Sir Radzig gave me orders and then he and the Skalitz folk carried on to Rattay.

Todos los del castillo estaban en las almenas, esperándose lo peor: el ejército de Segismundo. Para asombro de todos, resultó que eran sir Radzig y los supervivientes de Skalice. Lo que resultó aún más sorprendente es que escaparan del asedio sin tener que abrirse paso por las armas. Sir Radzig me dio unas órdenes y luego él y las gentes de Skalice continuaron hacia Rataje.

Just as I got back to the baths, bouquet in hand, I heard shouting I knew something serious was up. Some poor fool almost drowned His Lordship out of jealousy and if I hadn't come when I did... well, better not to dwell on that and have a drink instead.

Justo cuando regresé a los baños, ramo en mano, oí gritos y supe que algo grave estaba pasando. Un pobre infeliz casi ahoga a Su Excelencia por celos, y si yo no llego a aparecer cuando lo dice... En fin, mejor no pensar en ello y tomar un trago.
I think I've got all the flowers. Enough running around for one night - time to go back to the bathhouse.
Creo que tengo todas las flores. Ya basta de corretear por ahí de noche, es hora de volver a la casa de baños.
Captain Robard didn't want to leave anything to chance, so he posted extra guards on the battlements and I had to join them too.
Sir Robard no dejó nada al azar. Ha puesto guardias adicionales en las almenas y me he tenido que unir a ellos.
Sir Robard didn't want to leave anything to chance. He posted extra guards on the battlements and ordered me to join them.
Sir Robard no dejó nada al azar. Ha puesto guardias adicionales en las almenas y me ha ordenado que me una a ellos.
On the advice of one of the soldiers, I had a bit of a snooze, but then another alarm was sounded.
Por consejo de uno de los soldados, dormí un poco. Pero, entonces, sonó otra alarma.
I can close my eyes and rest a while. If anything happens, the soldiers will wake me.
Puedo cerrar los ojos y descansar un poco. Si algo pasara, los soldados me despertarían.

When I got to the battlements my blood turned cold. Sigismund's army was standing within sight of the castle. Everyone fell silent as the grave when they saw the huge numbers of the enemy. Fortunately, Sir Divish has a way with words. He persuaded the negotiator that attacking Talmberg would be pointless. The moment Sigismund gave the order to depart, the whole of Talmberg shouted with joy. But I had only one thing on my mind - I should go back to Skalitz and bury my parents.

Cuando llegué a las almenas, la sangre se me congeló en las venas. El ejército de Segismundo estaba a la vista del castillo. Cuando se pudo ver el número de los enemigos, un ominoso silencio se abatió sobre el castillo. Por suerte, sir Divish tenía facilidad de palabra. Persuadió al negociador de que no tenía sentido atacar Talmberk. En el momento en que Segismundo dio la orden de partir, todo Talmberk estalló de júbilo. Pero en mi cabeza solo había sitio para una idea: debía volver a Skalice y enterrar a mis padres.
Something's going on outside the castle. I must go and see what it's about.
Pasa algo fuera del castillo. Debo ir, a ver qué ocurre.
I found Sir Robard of Talmberg. He's as intimidating as he always was.
I found Sir Robard of Talmberg. He's as intimidating as he always was.
I found out from the soldiers that they engaged with the bandits. The garrison commander Sir Robard should be able to tell me more.
I found out from the soldiers that they engaged with the bandits. The garrison commander Sir Robard should be able to tell me more.
They're history. It was bloody work, but worth the reward.
They're history. It was bloody work, but worth the reward.
Sir Robard sent me to track down any of the attackers lying low in the nearby woods. He says he'll pay me six score Groschen for every one I kill.
Sir Robard sent me to track down any of the attackers lying low in the nearby woods. He says he'll pay me six score Groschen for every one I kill.
If the robbery was to succeed, I'd have to have more information. I found out when the quarrymen's wages would be transported, but we didn't have much time to prepare for the hold-up.
Para que el robo tuviera éxito, tenía que recabar más información. Averigüé cuándo iban a transportar el salario de los canteros, pero no teníamos mucho tiempo para preparar la operación.
If we're to pull off this robbery, we need to know more. I was given the task of finding out when they'll be transporting the coin from Talmberg.
Si vamos a llevar a cabo el robo, necesitamos saber más. Mi tarea es averiguar cuándo iban a partir de Talmberk con el dinero.
I got a reward for killing Magda's father and Woyzeck's wife.
I got a reward for killing Magda's father and Woyzeck's wife.
I did what Magda wanted and now I have the blood of two innocent people on my hands. But she'll reward me.
I did what Magda wanted and now I have the blood of two innocent people on my hands. But she'll reward me.
Sir Robard was convinced in the end. Who wouldn't be?
Sir Robard was convinced in the end. Who wouldn't be?

Sir Robard doesn't believe I'm capable of defeating the attackers. I need to get proper arms and armour and some combat training. And helping the soldiers and folk in the vicinity will stand me in good stead.

Sir Robard doesn't believe I'm capable of defeating the attackers. I need to get proper arms and armour and some combat training. And helping the soldiers and folk in the vicinity will stand me in good stead.
They say there's a herb woman living in the woods to the west of Samopesch who knows about healing.
They say there's a herb woman living in the woods to the west of Samopesch who knows about healing.
I have to ask around whether anyone knows about healing wounds.
I have to ask around whether anyone knows about healing wounds.
I had a job convincing that damned hag to go to the camp. I hope she gets there before it's too late.
I had a job convincing that damned hag to go to the camp. I hope she gets there before it's too late.
The herb woman lives in the woods nearby Samopesch. She will surely ease the dying soldier's suffering.
The herb woman lives in the woods nearby Samopesch. She will surely ease the dying soldier's suffering.
Poppies serve as an additive in the incense, so I got at least ten.
Uno de los ingredientes del incienso es la amapola, así que tuve que encontrar al menos diez.
One of the ingredients for the incense is poppy. I need to find at least ten of them.
Uno de los ingredientes del incienso es la amapola. Tengo que encontrar al menos diez.
In the end I managed to get out of the castle to go back to Skalitz.
Al final me las arreglé para salir del castillo y volver a Skalice.
The threat of attack is gone and I have to get back to Skalitz. It's my duty to bury my parents, only how can I do it? My lord forbids me to leave Talmberg.
Se ha disipado la amenaza de un ataque y ahora tengo que volver a Skalice. Mi deber es enterrar a mis padres aunque, ¿cómo hacerlo? Mi señor me prohíbe que salga de Talmberk.
I talked to Sir Robard about how to get out of the castle, but my pleas fell on deaf ears.
He hablado con sir Robard sobre la posibilidad de salir del castillo, pero mis súplicas cayeron en oídos sordos.
I should talk to Captain Robard. Maybe he'll help me get out of the castle.
Debería hablar con el capitán Robard. Puede que él me ayude a salir del castillo.
There was nothing on Pavel's corpse, but it seems one of the soldiers, Andreas, found something.
There was nothing on Pavel's corpse, but it seems one of the soldiers, Andreas, found something.
Ludmila asked me to find the deeds for their house in Kuttenberg. The last one to have the document was her brother-in-law, Pavel, but he was killed on the farm by the Cumans who attacked it.
Ludmila asked me to find the deeds for their house in Kuttenberg. The last one to have the document was her brother-in-law, Pavel, but he was killed on the farm by the Cumans who attacked it.
Things got a little out of hand. Instead of chastisement, it ended with murder. The locals probably won't be too happy about it.
Things got a little out of hand. Instead of chastisement, it ended with murder. The locals probably won't be too happy about it.
There's a soldier who spends his time in the Samopesch tavern and doesn't behave very gallantly. I should give him a bit of a lesson in chivalry.
There's a soldier who spends his time in the Samopesch tavern and doesn't behave very gallantly. I should give him a bit of a lesson in chivalry.
Miroslav was beyond help, but at least his passing was eased a little. Sir Robard will be sorry to lose a swordsman.
Miroslav was beyond help, but at least his passing was eased a little. Sir Robard will be sorry to lose a swordsman.
I should ask Martin how things turned out with Miroslav.
I should ask Martin how things turned out with Miroslav.
The herb woman took a bit of persuasion, but in the end she said she would come and have a look at the wounded soldiers.
The herb woman took a bit of persuasion, but in the end she said she would come and have a look at the wounded soldiers.
There are several wounded men at the soldiers' encampment by Merhojed. I promised I would bring the herbalist from Samopesch to help them.
There are several wounded men at the soldiers' encampment by Merhojed. I promised I would bring the herbalist from Samopesch to help them.
I've got proof that Leshek is black marketeering. Now I can go and report on him to Sir Robard.
I've got proof that Leshek is black marketeering. Now I can go and report on him to Sir Robard.
Sir Robard wants me to find evidence that Leshek is black marketeering. Maybe it would be enough to buy something from him that couldn't come from anywhere except the encampment.
Sir Robard wants me to find evidence that Leshek is black marketeering. Maybe it would be enough to buy something from him that couldn't come from anywhere except the encampment.
I found Ludmila, who wanted to talk to me alone, out of earshot of her husband..
I found Ludmila, who wanted to talk to me alone, out of earshot of her husband..
Johann sent me to Ludmila, who might have some job for me. I should find her somewhere in the vicinity of their stud farm in Merhojed.
Johann sent me to Ludmila, who might have some job for me. I should find her somewhere in the vicinity of their stud farm in Merhojed.
It seems I can dress as one of the Talmberg soldiers and get out of the castle in that guise. It must be possible to find a guard's armour in the guardhouse.
Parece que puedo disfrazarme de soldado de Talmberk y salir así del castillo. Quizá sea posible encontrar una armadura en la casa del guardia.
I promised the herb woman I'd bring her poppy infusion, marigold infusion and five handfuls of comfrey.
I promised the herb woman I'd bring her poppy infusion, marigold infusion and five handfuls of comfrey.
I promised to help the herb woman. She has to take care of the wounded at the encampment and she's running out of supplies. She asked me to get some things for her.
I promised to help the herb woman. She has to take care of the wounded at the encampment and she's running out of supplies. She asked me to get some things for her.
I should go and see the herb woman in the soldiers' encampment. She mentioned she would need help tending the casualties.
I should go and see the herb woman in the soldiers' encampment. She mentioned she would need help tending the casualties.
Hagen wanted a good, reliable cook who'd be capable of cooking food fit for nobles and church dignitaries. I didn't know if there was anyone like that among the Skalitz folk.
Hagen quería una cocinera buena y fiable, que fuera capaz de cocinar platos dignos de nobles y dignatarios eclesiásticos. No sé si habrá alguien así entre las gentes de Skalice.

The Bailiff also said that Merchant Hagen is looking for a cook and he's willing to take one of our people, but he has certain requirements. I need to go and talk to him about what he expects from the cook.

El merino también dijo que Hagen el comerciante busca una cocinera y está dispuesto a contratar a alguien de Skalice, pero tiene unos requisitos muy claros. Debo ir a hablar con él, a ver qué espera exactamente de la cocinera.

When I asked Alex about a cook for Hagen, he suggested Agnes, the devout housekeeper who used to take care of the Parish Priest of St. James' in Rovna. I hear she's most likely to be found in or around the Rattay church.

Cuando pregunté a Alex por una cocinera para Hagen, me sugirió a Agnes, el ama de llaves piadosa que se encargaba del sacerdote de San Jaime, en Rovná. Me han dicho que probablemente la encuentre en la iglesia de Rataje o no lejos de ella.

Those interested in work will meet in front of the Rathaus, so I don't have to go running around looking for them. I don't know how many there will be, but I hope I won't have to sort through a whole crowd.

Aquellos interesados en el trabajo estarán delante de la Casa Consistorial, así que no tengo que andar por ahí buscándolos. No sé cuántos habrá, pero espero que no tengamos que seleccionar entre una inmensa muchedumbre.
The Kolbens' farm was attacked and torched during the night. The soldiers managed to repel the attack, but there were casualties.
The Kolbens' farm was attacked and torched during the night. The soldiers managed to repel the attack, but there were casualties.
The Samopesch Bailiff asked me to find out why there's smoke rising from a farm between Merhojed and Samopesch.
The Samopesch Bailiff asked me to find out why there's smoke rising from a farm between Merhojed and Samopesch.
I finally found that sword. I'd better go and return it to its rightful owner.
I finally found that sword. I'd better go and return it to its rightful owner.
An old farmer from Merhojed lost his sword. He suspects the soldiers at the camp. Maybe I should go there and ask around?
An old farmer from Merhojed lost his sword. He suspects the soldiers at the camp. Maybe I should go there and ask around?
I managed to return the sword to the farmer in Merhojed. He didn't pay me much, but I gained a friend for life.
I managed to return the sword to the farmer in Merhojed. He didn't pay me much, but I gained a friend for life.
All I have to do now is take the sword to Dushek in Merhojed.
All I have to do now is take the sword to Dushek in Merhojed.
I found out the sword belongs to Dushek, a local farmer from Merhojed.
I found out the sword belongs to Dushek, a local farmer from Merhojed.
I found a lost sword nearby the encampment at Merhojed. Maybe it belongs to someone around here?
I found a lost sword nearby the encampment at Merhojed. Maybe it belongs to someone around here?
Of course I didn't forget my horse. Skalitz is too long a walk from here.
Por supuesto no me he olvidado de mi caballo. Skalice está a un largo camino de aquí.
I should take my horse. Skalitz is a long way from here.
Debería ir a por mi caballo. Skalice está a un largo camino de aquí.

One of the things the charlatan wanted me to get was a tooth from the remains of St. Procopius, which he wanted to sell. In fact, it was one farmhand named after the saint who supplied the tooth, and getting it was an adventure in itself.

Una de las cosas que el charlatán quería que consiguiera era un diente de los restos de san Procopio, que pretende vender. Lo cierto es que fue un jornalero también llamado Procopio quien procuró el diente, y conseguirlo fue toda una aventura.
I have to get a tooth from St. Procopious. Or any Procopius.
Tengo que hacerme con un diente de san Procopio. O de cualquier Procopio.
I dug the grave as Martin asked. It wasn't the most cheerful of tasks.
I dug the grave as Martin asked. It wasn't the most cheerful of tasks.
Martin asked me to dig a grave for his dead friend Miroslav. I'll need a spade for that.
Martin asked me to dig a grave for his dead friend Miroslav. I'll need a spade for that.
I found out the soldiers need a helping hand, or several for that matter.
I found out the soldiers need a helping hand, or several for that matter.
The Bailiff in Samopesch assigned me the task of finding out whether Sir Robard's soldiers need help with anything. I'd better go and ask them.
The Bailiff in Samopesch assigned me the task of finding out whether Sir Robard's soldiers need help with anything. I'd better go and ask them.
It was worth the effort! Coin aplenty!
It was worth the effort! Coin aplenty!
I succeeded in killing the attackers. Sir Robard will be pleased. I should go to him for my reward.
I succeeded in killing the attackers. Sir Robard will be pleased. I should go to him for my reward.

In the kitchen Captain Robard introduced me to the lady of the castle, Lady Stephanie, and the cook, Bozhena, who served me some food. They also offered me a place to sleep in the bedchamber of the lodge in the courtyard.

Ya en la cocina, el capitán Robard me ha presentado a la dama del castillo: lady Stephanie, y a la cocinera, Bozhena, que me ha servido algo de comida. También me han ofrecido un sitio en los dormitorios del pabellón del patio, para que descanse.
Captain Robard led me to the kitchen to get something to eat, only I got lost on the way. Now I'll have to find my own way there.
El capitán Robard me llevó hasta la cocina, para que comiera algo, pero me perdí por el camino. Ahora tengo que descubrir cómo llegar hasta allí.
The herbwoman really helped in the end. She definitely knows her craft.
Al final resultó que la herborista fue de gran ayuda. Conoce bien su oficio.
The herb woman might be able to help the groom with his problems.
Puede que la herborista sepa cómo ayudar al palafrenero con su problema.
An ordinary digestive potion could help the horses in Talmberg. I managed to get some.
Un brebaje digestivo normal ayudaría a los caballos de Talmberk. He conseguido un poco.
If I want to get a cure for the horses in Talmberg, an ordinary digestive potion should do the trick.
Si quiero conseguir una cura para los caballos de Talmberk, una poción digestiva normal debería servir.
I got the potion, now to take it to the groom.
Tengo el brebaje. Ahora puedo llevárselo al palafrenero.
I was to go to the clearing with the loot, which I did. It was time to share it out.
Tenía que ir al claro con el dinero, y lo hice. Era la hora de repartir.
I decided keep the loot and let my mates go to hell. What can I say? I just love coin.
Decidí quedarme el botín y que mis amigos se fueran al infierno. ¿Qué puedo decir? Me encanta el dinero.
I have to make it to the clearing between Talmberg and Rovna with the loot. It's just over the bridge by the hanged man. But do I really want to share the money?
Tengo que ir al claro que está entre Talmberk y Rovná con el botín. Está al cruzar el puente del ahorcado. Aunque... Pero ¿en serio quiero compartir el dinero?

Kunesh doesn't want to pay up and it seems he's got no coin anyway. Oh well, I'll just have to take back the things he didn't pay for, or find some other way to get the money he owes. I can't just let it go.

Kunesh no quiere pagar y parece que tampoco tiene dinero. Oh, bueno, tendré que recuperar los artículos que no pagó, o encontrar otra manera de conseguir el dinero que debe. Pero no puedo dejarlo correr.
The Bailiff was as horrified as I was. But at least he can start arranging help.
The Bailiff was as horrified as I was. But at least he can start arranging help.
I found out that the Kolbens' stud farm between Merhojed and Samopesch was attacked by bandits. I should report it to the Bailiff in Samopesch.
I found out that the Kolbens' stud farm between Merhojed and Samopesch was attacked by bandits. I should report it to the Bailiff in Samopesch.
Martin thanked me for helping him bury Miroslav. May he rest in peace.
Martin thanked me for helping him bury Miroslav. May he rest in peace.
All I have to do now is tell Martin the grave is dug.
All I have to do now is tell Martin the grave is dug.
Ludmila looked like a weight had fallen from her shoulders, and the deal worked out well for me too, so all's well that ends well.
Ludmila looked like a weight had fallen from her shoulders, and the deal worked out well for me too, so all's well that ends well.
I finally managed to get Andreas to give me that deed, which Ludmila is so concerned about. Now all I have to do is bring it to her.
I finally managed to get Andreas to give me that deed, which Ludmila is so concerned about. Now all I have to do is bring it to her.
The trail led from the herb-woman straight to the women she's sold the ointment to. They wanted to smear themselves with it and invoke dark powers to rid the land of the Cumans.
El rastro condujo de la herborista directamente a las mujeres a las que les vendió el ungüento. Querían untarse con él e invocar a los poderes oscuros para liberar la región de los cumanos.

Gertrude the herb-woman sold some village women of Uzhitz some weird magic lotion and now fears for their safety. She wants me to talk them out of using it, or at least to get a clear idea what their intentions are with it. The women are called Vera, Khuta and Zlata

Gertrude, la herborista, les ha vendido un ungüento mágico a unas mujeres de Úžice y ahora teme por su seguridad. Quiere que las convenza para que no lo usen o, al menos, que descubra qué pretenden hacer. Se llaman Vera, Khuta y Zlata.

Father Godwin asked me to investigate what was going on in Uzhitz. He said Gertrude the herb-woman had sold three women some magic ointment and he wanted me to find out more. Gertrude admitted it was true, but claimed she meant no harm. She said the ointment was just a herbal concoction, but it could cause strange visions.

El padre Godwin me pidió que investigara lo acontecido en Úžice. Dijo que Gertrude, la herborista, les había vendido un ungüento mágico a tres mujeres, y quería que averiguara más. Gertrude admitió que era cierto, pero aseguró que no tenía mala intención. Dijo que el ungüento era un brebaje de hierbas, aunque podía provocar alucinaciones.
The priest spoke of Gertrude the herb-woman having brought a few Uzhitz women to witchcraft. I'm to speak with her and find out what happened.
El sacerdote me ha dicho que Gertrude, la herborista, ha llevado a unas mujeres de Úžice por el camino de la brujería. Debo hablar con ella y descubrir qué ha pasado.
The women were meeting at night in the woods. I came along too and watched what was happening from a distance.
Las mujeres iban a reunirse en el bosque por la noche. Yo también acudí, y observé lo sucedido desde una distancia prudencial.
The women owned up to meeting in the woods at night and then doing something with that ointment. I ought to follow them and see.
Las mujeres van a reunirse en el bosque por la noche y harán algo con el ungüento. Debería seguirlas y ver qué hacen.
I got involved in the incantations and invocations of the Devil and the women took me for his messenger, if not the Satan himself.
Me he involucrado en los encantamientos y la invocación del Diablo, y las mujeres me tomaron por su enviado, si no por el mismo Satán personificado.
It’s all going a bit wrong. Maybe I should intervene.
Todo está yendo mal. Quizá debería intervenir.

After I got involved in the sabbath, the women pounced on me and smeared the ointment on me, so I very soon joined them in their diabolical trip. The whole world changed before my eyes. The last thing I remember is that the women wanted me to cavort with them. But then came a rude awakening - some woodcutters burst into the clearing and wanted to kill the women.

Después de que yo me involucrara en su aquelarre, las mujeres se lanzaron sobre me mí y me untaron con su ungüento de manera que no tardé en acompañarlas en su diabólico viaje. El mundo cambió ante mis ojos. Lo último que recuerdo es que las mujeres querían que fornicara con ellas. Pero entonces llegó un brusco despertar: unos leñadores entraron en el claro y querían matar a las mujeres.
I guess I will never find out how my cavorting with the village women went. The ointment made me pass out.
Supongo que nunca descubriré cómo fue gozar de las mujeres del pueblo. El ungüento me hizo perder el sentido.
I am the devil. The Prince of Darkness and Ruler of the Underworld, arisen! I have to consort with women. This instant!
Soy el Diablo. Príncipe de las Tinieblas y Señor del Inframundo. Tengo que gozar de las mujeres. ¡Ahora mismo!

I told the Parish Priest what happened in the woods - that I'd fought with some woodcutters who wanted to hack the Devil out of the witches, although in the visions I was having I took them for demons themselves. I think this will be troubling my conscience for a long time yet.

Le relaté al cura de la parroquia lo que había pasado en el bosque: que había luchado contra unos leñadores que querían hacer trizas a las brujas aunque, por culpa de las visiones, yo los tomé a ellos por demonios. Creo que esto pesará mucho tiempo sobre mi conciencia.
I woke as if from a bad dream. On the spot where the Devil was being invoked yesterday are the dead bodies of woodcutters. I should tell the Parish Priest.
Me desperté de un mal sueño. En el punto donde ayer se estaba invocando al Diablo están los cadáveres de unos leñadores. Debería contárselo al sacerdote.

I watched what happened in the women's sabbath. They smeared themselves with the ointment and then started acting like they were out of their minds, talking nonsense and behaving as if they were seeing visions. They kept going on about how God had forsaken them and called on the Prince of Darkness.

Vi lo que pasó en el aquelarre. Se embadurnaron con un ungüento y comenzaron a actuar como si hubieran perdido la cabeza: decían cosas sin sentido y se comportaban como si tuvieran visiones. No pararon de repetir que Dios las había abandonado y de invocar al Príncipe de las Tinieblas.
I should keep an eye on the women from a distance, but not get mixed up in what they're doing.
Debo vigilar a las mujeres de lejos y sin involucrarme en lo que están haciendo.

I succeeded in the end, although it almost cost me my life. Those foreign mercenaries of Sigismund's are skilled at archery on horseback. They pursued me and I took an arrow in the leg. It's a wonder I didn't bleed to death.

Al final he tenido éxito, aunque casi me cuesta la vida. Esos mercenarios extranjeros de Segismundo son maestros de la arquería a caballo. Me persiguieron y me acertaron en la pierna con una flecha. Es asombroso que no me haya desangrado hasta morir.
Now I have to make it to Talmberg in one piece.
Ahora tengo que llegar a Talmberk de una pieza.
My first task was to meet the Vicar, who looked and sounded to me like a typical emissary of Holy Mother Church - a little arrogant and haughty. But then he has to shepherd his flock, I suppose.
Mi primera tarea fue encontrarme con el vicario, que a mí me pareció el típico emisario de la Santa Madre Iglesia: algo arrogante y altanero. Pero supongo que así tiene que pastorear su rebaño.
My first task was to go to Uzhitz, find the Vicar and report to him. Let's hope my status as Sir Hanush's envoy will make the right impression on him.
Mi primera tarea era ir a Úžice, buscar al vicario e informarle. Esperemos que mi posición como enviado de sir Hanush ayude a darle una buena impresión.
I managed to track down the place where the heretics probably assembled. It was a small, well-hidden glade close to the Uzhitz fishpond.
Conseguí encontrar el lugar donde probablemente se reúnan los herejes. Era un pequeño y recóndito claro, cercano al estanque de Úžice.
The Vicar gave me the testimony of a tortured heretic that should help me find the heretics' assembly place. The only advice he gave me was to start at the local tavern.
El vicario me ha dado el testimonio de un hereje torturado, que debería ayudarme a encontrar el lugar de reunión de los herejes. El único consejo que me dio fue que empezara en la taberna local.

I was convinced someone in the village would recognise such a distinctive cross, and my investigation ultimately led me to the Parish Priest, Father Godwin. He was concerned about my intentions though - he'd like to avoid a witch hunt, even though it's clear there is heresy happening in Uzhitz. But in the end I talked him round and he told me the cross belonged to the Bauer family.

Estaba convencido de que alguien del pueblo podría reconocer una cruz tan peculiar y, al final, mis investigaciones me llevaron al sacerdote de la parroquia, el padre Godwin. Pero este estaba preocupado por mis intenciones, ya que aunque parece claro que en Úžice hay algún tipo de herejía, preferiría evitar una caza de brujas. Al final conseguí convencerlo y me dijo que la cruz pertenece a la familia Bauer.
The carved wooden cross I found is very distinctive, so someone in the village might recognise it.
La cruz de madera tallada que he encontrado parece muy peculiar, así que alguien del pueblo podría reconocerla.
The Vicar was none too surprised by my report. It seems the locals already told him some things about the Bauers. Nevertheless, he asked me to verify his suspicions in a very crafty way.
El vicario no quedó muy sorprendido por mi informe. Parece que los lugareños ya le habían hablado de los Bauer. En cualquier caso, me pidió que verificara sus sospechas de manera discreta.
The cross belongs to the Bauer family. I'd better tell the Vicar.
La cruz pertenece a la familia Bauer. Será mejor que informe al vicario.

I crept up into the Bauers' loft to eavesdrop on their evening prayer. And it was peculiar alright - not the prayer itself, which was just the same as in every home, but the fact that it was led by a woman, Mistress Bauer. I heard nothing else that could be regarded as heresy, but from the conversation at supper, it was clear they all feared the Vicar. Mistress Bauer and her husband are even determined to confess to the Vicar, while the hands are planning to flee.

Me he colado en el desván de los Bauer para escuchar su oración de la tarde. Y sin duda que era peculiar. No la oración por sí misma, que es la misma que en cualquier otra casa, pero sí el hecho de que la dirigiera una mujer: la señora Bauer. No escuché nada más que pudiera considerarse herejía, pero de la conversación de la cena quedó claro que todos tenían miedo del vicario. La señora Bauer y su marido están decididos a confesar ante el vicario, mientras que los jornaleros planean huir.
The Bauers and their farm hands meet every evening for supper. I'm to creep into their loft and eavesdrop on how they pray. That should clarify whether they're heretics or not.
Los Bauer y sus jornaleros se reúnen cada noche para cenar. Debo colarme en su desván y escuchar qué rezan. Eso debería clarificar si son herejes o no lo son.
Miller Woyzeck has had a proper burial. Lord, guide him with your heavenly light.
Miller Woyzeck has had a proper burial. Lord, guide him with your heavenly light.
My last task for Miller Woyzeck: make sure he has a Christian burial in consecrated ground. Even if I have to dig his grave myself, which is exactly what I have in mind.
My last task for Miller Woyzeck: make sure he has a Christian burial in consecrated ground. Even if I have to dig his grave myself, which is exactly what I have in mind.
I found out the sword belongs to Dushek, a local farmer from Merhojed.
I found out the sword belongs to Dushek, a local farmer from Merhojed.
I found a lost sword nearby the encampment at Merhojed. Maybe it belongs to someone around here?
I found a lost sword nearby the encampment at Merhojed. Maybe it belongs to someone around here?
I managed to return the sword to the farmer in Merhojed. He didn't pay me much, but I gained a friend for life.
I managed to return the sword to the farmer in Merhojed. He didn't pay me much, but I gained a friend for life.
All I have to do now is take the sword to Dushek in Merhojed.
All I have to do now is take the sword to Dushek in Merhojed.
Apart from poppies, I also needed flowers from the grave of the departed for the incense to dispel the restless spirit. I found the grave and plucked all the flowers growing on it.
Además de la amapola, también necesito flores de la tumba del finado para que el incienso consiga expulsar al espíritu inquieto. Encontré la tumba y arranqué todas las flores que crecían sobre ella.
To banish the ghost, I need flowers from his grave.
Para expulsar al fantasma, necesito flores de su tumba.
I performed the smudging ritual in Drahomira's cottage and chanted the spell, just as the herb woman advised me. The ghost should be gone.
He realizado un ritual de conjuro en la choza de Drahomira y recitado el hechizo, tal y como la herborista me aconsejó. Ahora el fantasma debería haber desaparecido.
I have everything I need. Now I can perform the smudging ritual.
Tengo todo lo que necesito. Ahora puedo realizar el ritual de conjuro.
I was still hoping against all the odds they might somehow have survived… But they were dead.
Aún tenía la esperanza de que, contra todo pronóstico, hubieran logrado sobrevivir... Pero estaban muertos.
I have to find my parents' bodies and bury them. Unless someone moved them, they should still be lying where they were cut down.
Tengo que encontrar a mis padres y enterrarlos. A menos que alguien los haya desplazado, aún yacerán donde fueron abatidos.
I found my parents bodies and others too. Now I have to find a spade to dig a grave under the linden tree, as my father wished. It should be no problem to find a spade in the village.

Encontré los cuerpos de mis padres y también de otros. Ahora he de buscar una pala para excavar una tumba bajo el tilo, tal y como deseaba mi padre. No debería suponer un problema encontrar una pala en la aldea.
I’ve found out the Sasau blacksmith hasn't been muttering spells, just a little stupid ditty he recites to time the stages of tempering.
He averiguado que el herrero no farfulla hechicería, sino una estúpida rima que le ayuda a sincronizar las diferentes fases de su trabajo.

I'll have to be very cautious about getting any information from the Sasau blacksmith. By all accounts he’s a grouchy bastard who doesn't like anyone poking their nose into his craft. Maybe it would be better to try asking one of his family?

Debo tener mucha cautela al recabar la información sobre el herrero de Sázava. No cabe duda de que es un malnacido gruñón al que no le gusta que metan las narices en sus asuntos. Quizá sería más aconsejable preguntar a alguien de su familia.
I managed in the end to repeat the rhyme to the Ledetchko blacksmith and he rewarded me for it. Maybe I should memorise it - if I ever go back to the trade it could come in handy.
Finalmente conseguí repetir la rima al herrero de Ledečko y me recompensó por ello. Quizá deba memorizarla. Si alguna vez vuelvo al negocio, me será útil.
All I have to do is listen to the whole of the Sasau blacksmith's rhyme, remember it and then repeat it to his Ledetchko rival.
Lo único que tengo que hacer es escuchar la rima completa del herrero de Sázava, recordarla y luego repetírsela a su rival de Ledečko.
After a brief and none too amicable agreement, we set off together on the hunt.
Después de llegar a un breve y no especialmente amigable acuerdo, partimos juntos para cazar.
I met Sir Hans on the way and we compared our catches.
Me he reunido con sir Hans por el camino y hemos comparado nuestras capturas.
I'm to meet Sir Hans Capon in the morning in the courtyard of Rattay Upper Castle.
Debo reunirme por la mañana con sir Hans Capon en el patio del castillo mayor de Rataje.
I've got a horse. Now I have to go and tell Sir Hans I'm ready to go hunting with him.
I've got a horse. Now I have to go and tell Sir Hans I'm ready to go hunting with him.
Now all I have to do is get myself a horse.
Now all I have to do is get myself a horse.

Since the smudging didn't work, I asked the Rattay Apothecary what might help. He told me I had to get hold of something that belonged to the departed, and an old book of spells, which won't be easy, since the book is banned.

Puesto que el ritual de conjuro no funcionó, le pregunté al boticario de Rataje si sabía de algo que pudiera ayudarnos. Me dijo que tenía que hacerme con algo que perteneciera al difunto y con un viejo libro de hechizos, lo que no será fácil, ya que el libro está prohibido.
Smudging didn't help. I could ask the Apothecary in Rattay if he knows about other methods of getting rid of restless spirits.
El conjuro no ha funcionado. Debería preguntar al boticario de Rataje si conoce algún otro método para librarse de espíritus inquietos.
Since the whole burned-down farm belonged to Alois, a piece of charred wood from it should do.
Como toda la granja quemada era de Alois, un trozo de madera quemada debería ser suficiente.

When I was trying to bury my parents, Zbyshek turned up again, and he wasn't alone. That treacherous bastard brought a gang of bandits with him, led by a frightening giant of a man, who took a fancy to my father's sword. I tried to defend myself and hold onto it, but I had no chance against that huge bastard. Just when I thought my last moment had come, Theresa the mill maid turned up with Captain Robard of Talmberg and his men. They scattered the bandits, but their leader got away with my sword, the only thing I had to remember my father by.

Cuando intentaba dar sepultura a mis padres, Zbyshek volvió a aparecer, y esta vez no estaba solo. Ese bellaco traicionero vino acompañado de una banda de bandidos liderados por un temible gigante, que le echó el ojo a la espada de mi padre. Yo intenté defender y aferrarme a la espada, pero poco podía hacer contra aquel inmenso canalla. Cuando creí que había llegado mi hora, Theresa, la molinera, apareció con el capitán Robard de Talmberk y sus hombres. Dispersaron a los bandidos y me salvaron la vida, pero su líder consiguió huir con mi espada. Perdí la única cosa que tenía para recordar a mi padre.
Now to dig a grave for my parents under the linden tree by the forge. God, this is going to be very hard to do.
Ahora debo excavar una sepultura para mis padres bajo el tilo, junto a la forja. Dios, esto va a ser muy duro.
I got blind drunk and woke up with my head pounding like a hammer on an anvil. This scourge must be brutal enough.
I got blind drunk and woke up with my head pounding like a hammer on an anvil. This scourge must be brutal enough.
I've got the cure. Now all I have to do is get drunk as a lord and try it out. I'll have to keep drinking until I can drink no more.
I've got the cure. Now all I have to do is get drunk as a lord and try it out. I'll have to keep drinking until I can drink no more.
That's a relief! It seems the potion with the honey works. My head's no longer pounding and my stomach no longer wants to come up through my throat.
That's a relief! It seems the potion with the honey works. My head's no longer pounding and my stomach no longer wants to come up through my throat.
I can try that cure for the scourge with honey in it.
I can try that cure for the scourge with honey in it.
The potion is ready. Now to take it to Father Godwin.
The potion is ready. Now to take it to Father Godwin.

A priest was my last hope for getting rid of the ghost, so I went to see Father Godwin about it, but he said the problem was not with the dead, but with the living. He thought Drahomira had a troubled conscience. But why?

Un sacerdote parecía ser mi última esperanza para librarme del fantasma, así que fui a ver al padre Godwin, quien me dijo que el problema no era con los muertos, sino con los vivos. En su opinión, Drahomira no tenía la conciencia tranquila. Pero, ¿por qué?
A priest is my last hope for getting rid of the ghost. I should go and see Father Godwin - no doubt he'll advise me.
Un sacerdote es mi última esperanza para librarme del fantasma. Debería ir a ver al padre Godwin; sin duda él me aconsejará.
I made a potion to cure Father Godwin's divine scourge according to the Sasau apothecary's recipe.
I made a potion to cure Father Godwin's divine scourge according to the Sasau apothecary's recipe.
Father Godwin is suffering from divine retribution for his drinking. He asked me to go to the Sasau apothecary for a cure.
Father Godwin is suffering from divine retribution for his drinking. He asked me to go to the Sasau apothecary for a cure.
I arranged at the quarry for a conciliatory cross to be raised, which should put the troubled soul to rest forever.
He pedido que me fabriquen una cruz de redención en la cantera, para así, hacer que el alma en pena descanse para siempre.
What's needed is to raise a conciliatory cross. I can arrange for one in the quarry.
Es necesario erigir una cruz de redención. Puedo pedir que me hagan una en la cantera.
With Sir Divish's permission, I went to the monastery. But I can't just wander around there at will, and that goes double for the construction site.
Con permiso de sir Divish, acudí al monasterio. Pero no puedo vagar por ahí como me plazca y eso es aún más cierto con las obras.
I should go to the monastery and see if there's any truth in this talk about bad quality stone.
Debería ir al monasterio y averiguar si hay algo de cierto en esos rumores sobre la piedra de mala calidad.
From the Master Builder I found out more about the accident. Apparently there had been other occurrences complicating the building works too.
He descubierto más sobre el accidente gracias al maestro constructor. Parece que ha habido más incidentes que han complicado los trabajos.
The Master Builder can tell me more about the accident and point me in the right direction.
El maestro constructor me puede contar más sobre el accidente y también podrá orientarme algo.
The Neuhof stud farm was raided by bandits. The description of their leader matches that of the huge bastard who stole my father's sword, Runt.
La granja de caballos Neuhof ha sido asaltada por bandoleros. La descripción de su líder encaja con la del enorme malnacido que robó la espada de mi padre: Tapón.
I have to find the bastard who stole the sword from me. I believe he goes by the nickname Runt and has something to do with Zbyshek from Skalitz.
Tengo que encontrar al desgraciado que me robó la espada, creo que le llaman Tapón y tiene alguna relación con Zbyshek de Skalice.
Andrew was happy with his share, and so was I. Only Adam lost out, but that's how it goes sometimes.
Andrew ha quedado contento con su parte, igual que yo. El único que pierde es Adam, pero así son las cosas.
I shook almost everything he stole out of him. Andrew will be happy with his share.
He conseguido sacarle casi todo lo que robó. Andrew quedará satisfecho con su parte.
Adam was happy I got his coin back and wanted to reward me.
Adam se ha alegrado cuando le he devuelto su dinero y quería recompensarme.
I got all the loot out of the thief. I'm curious what Adam will have to say about it.
He conseguido sacarle todo lo que robó al ladrón. Me pregunto qué dirá Adam.

Skalitz was razed by King Sigismund of Hungary's army, but the attack itself was led by a knight whose coat of arms was a shield with one half gold with three red bars and the other half plain red. He was the one who murdered my parents. It didn't take me long to find out who he was, because Sigismund's army also approached Talmberg and sent a negotiator to parley. It was him, and he even introduced himself by name - Markvart von Aulitz! And I was helpless to do anything. But one day I will find him!

Skalice ha sido arrasada por el ejército húngaro del rey Segismundo, pero el ataque fue dirigido por un caballero que tenía como blasón oro con tres barras rojas en un flanco y en el otro, gules. Fue él quien asesino a mis padres. No me costó mucho descubrir quién era, porque el ejército de Segismundo también fue a Talmberk y le enviaron a parlamentar. Fue él. Y se presentó con su nombre: ¡Markvart von Aulitz! Y yo nada pude hacer. ¡Pero algún día daré con él!

I went to the castle to see Sir Radzig. He didn’t seem too concerned that I lost his sword and even took me into his service, despite the protests of the priest and the other lords! But first I have to undergo basic training.

Acudí al castillo para ver a sir Radzig. No pareció preocuparse demasiado porque hubiera perdido su espada, e incluso me tomó a su servicio, a pesar de las protestas de los sacerdotes y de los demás señores. Pero antes debo realizar un entrenamiento básico.
I have to go to Pirkstein Castle to see Sir Radzig and tell him what happened.
Debo ir al castillo de Pirkštejn a ver a sir Radzig y decirle lo que ha ocurrido.
I hate to quit, but I didn't have much choice. I didn't find out which one of them it was.
Odio rendirme, pero no me queda mucha elección. No he descubierto quién fue.

I squeezed them a little too hard. Now I'll never find out from them who did it and where he hid the loot. I can poke around the nooks and crannies and see what I can find, but I might be leaving empty-handed.
Les he apretado demasiado. Ahora nunca me dirán quién lo hizo y dónde escondió el botín. Puedo buscar por nichos y grietas, a ver qué encuentro, pero bien podría terminar con las manos vacías.

The groom told me the details of the Talmberg course. It's to be a ribbon race. The ribbons mark five points the riders have to pass in the correct order, but they can take any route they like between those points, which will have a decisive influence on who finishes fastest.

El palafrenero me contó detalles del circuito de Talmberk. Será una carrera de cintas. Las cintas marcan cinco puntos que los jinetes han de pasar en el orden correcto, pero entre los puntos pueden tomar la ruta que deseen. Es algo que tendrá una influencia vital para ver quién acaba antes.
The Talmberg stablemaster should fill me in on the race's details.
El jefe de cuadra de Talmberk me informará sobre los detalles de la carrera.
The thief had already spent most of the coin, but Adam was grateful even for the little that was left. He'd already mourned his loss anyway.
El ladrón ya se había gastado la mayor parte del dinero, pero Adam estaba agradecido por lo poco que quedaba. De todos modos, ya había lamentado su pérdida.
There wasn't much left of the coin, but at least Adam is left with something.
No quedaba mucho del dinero, pero al menos algo le queda a Adam.
The charlatan had taken to his heels, but the angry mob was still storming his house. I managed to get rid of them in the end, meanwhile giving my erstwhile employer a chance to make good his escape.
El charlatán se había esfumado, pero la turba furiosa aún asaltaba su casa. Al final conseguí librarme de ellos, a la vez que di a mi pasado cliente una oportunidad para conseguir escapar.
The mob is breaking into the house. I've got to delay them!
La turba está entrando en la casa. ¡Tengo que retrasarlos!
Unfortunately I didn't do very well in the race. At least I reported to Sir Divish and he was glad I was safe and sound.
Por desgracia, no me fue demasiado bien en la carrera. Al menos, informe a sir Divish y se alegró de que estuviera sano y salvo.
The race most likely finished long ago. Zora won't be happy. In any case, I'd better go see Sir Divish first so he knows I didn't end up lying in some ditch with a broken leg.

Es probable que la carrera haya terminado hace ya bastante. Zora no estará contenta. En cualquier caso, será mejor que vaya a ver primero a Divish, para que sepa que no estoy tirado en una zanja perdida, con una pierna rota.
I brought Adam back his cross and he was glad the heirloom hadn't been lost forever.
Devolví a Adam su cruz, y se alegró de que su herencia familiar no se hubiera perdido para siempre.
I got that lost cross back.
I need to bring the dappled grey back to Zora and tell her how I fared.
Tengo que devolverle a Zora el pinto gris y decirle qué tal me ha ido.
I must speak with Zora in Neuhof.
He de hablar con Zora, en Neuhof.
There's no sign of the Parish Priest of St. James since the raid on Skalitz. He's not among the refugees. If I can find him, I can try and persuade him to return to his parish.

Desde el ataque a Skalice no hay señales del sacerdote de la parroquia de San Jaime. No se cuenta entre los refugiados. Si pudiera encontrarlo podría intentar convencerlo para que volviera a su parroquia.

Father Simon's housekeeper was called Mary. According to her parents, she did more than keep house for the priest and in the end fell pregnant. Tragically, both she and her child died during the birth and Simon took it very hard. He became a recluse and eventually fled. But Mary's mother thinks Simon has returned to the area, because someone has been putting wreaths of comfrey, Mary's favourite flower, on her memorial cross.

El ama de llaves del padre Simon se llamaba Mary. Según sus padres no se limitaba a cuidar de la casa del sacerdote y, al final, acabó quedando encinta. Por desgracia, tanto ella como el niño murieron durante el parto y Simon se lo tomó muy mal. Se convirtió en un recluso y algo después, desapareció. Pero la madre de Mary cree que Simon ha vuelto a la zona porque alguien ha estado poniendo ramos de consueldas, la flor favorita de Mary, en su cruz conmemorativa.
The only lead I have to Father Simon is the family of his deceased housekeeper. I could try asking them if they know anything about Simon's sudden appearance in the woods.
La única pista que tengo sobre el padre Simon es la familia del ama de llaves fallecida. Podría intentar preguntarles si saben algo acerca de la repentina aparición de Simon en los bosques.
I liked the look of the game, so I joined it.
Me gustó el juego, así que me decidí a participar.
All you need to play Chumps is a bow and arrow and a bit of skill at using them. If I want to play, I'll have to go and see Vatzek in the morning.
Para jugar al troncos solo se necesita un arco, flechas y un poco de habilidad. Si quiero jugar, tengo que ir a ver a Vatzek por la mañana.
What kind of contest would it be without a little wager to make it interesting?
¿Qué clase de torneo sería sin apostar algo para hacerlo interesante?
It looks like I’m ready. I just need to give the word to Vatzek and we can begin.
Creo que ya estoy listo. Solo tengo que avisar a Vatzek y podremos empezar.
I'm to move to the starting position with the others. It’s a clear spot on the riverbank, downstream
Debo colocarme en la posición inicial junto a los demás. Es un claro junto a la orilla, río abajo.
Off we go! Now I have to shoot as many arrows as I can into the logs.
¡Adelante! Ahora tengo que clavar todas las flechas que pueda en los leños.
I finished shooting my first game of Chumps. Vatzek judged my performance and told me I can come and play again any morning.
Te terminado mi primera partida de troncos. Vatzek ha valorado mi actuación y me ha dicho que puedo volver a jugar cualquier mañana.
I finished shooting. Time to talk to Vatzek about the outcome.
He terminado de disparar. Es hora de ir a preguntar el resultado a Vatzek.
Since I did so well at the Chumps game, Vatzek has taught me a new trick with a bow.
Puesto que lo he hecho bien en la partida de troncos, Vatzek me ha enseñado un truco con el arco.
It seems I made quite an impression on Vatzek. I'm to come by his home - he says he has something for me.
Parece que he impresionado a Vatzek. Debo ir a su casa. Dice que tiene algo para mí.
I got a pitcher for the wine I have to get for Sir Hans.
Tengo una jarra para el vino que tengo que conseguir para sir Hans.
I can't carry the whole barrel; I'll have to get a pitcher somewhere.
No puedo cargar con el barril entero, tendré que hacerme con una jarra.
I've collected all fifteen herbs that Brother Nicodemus wants for his new herbarium.
He recogido las quince hierbas que el hermano Nicodemus quiere para su nuevo herbario.

I have to collect belladonna, chamomile, comfrey, dandelion, eyebright, St. John's wort, marigold, mint, herb Paris, poppy, sage, thistle, nettle, valerian and wormwood. Once I have them, I am to take them to Bother Nicodemus.

Tengo que recoger belladona, manzanilla, consuelda, diente de león, malta, hierba de San Juan, caléndula, menta, uva de raposa, amapola, salvia, cardo, ortiga, valeriana y ajenjo. Cuando las tenga todas, debo llevárselas al hermano Nicodemus.

Hare's plan was a bold one. While he lured Nicholas out of his lodge, I had to deal with the hardest part - grabbing Nicholas' wife and basically abducting her. But everything went as planned. I got Margaret to the mine gallery safe and sound, although she was none to keen on it.

El plan de Liebre era bastante osado. Mientras él atraía a Nicholas fuera de su casa, yo tendría que encargarme de la parte más difícil, sacar a la mujer de Nicholas. Secuestrarla. Pero todo fue según lo planeado. Tengo a Margaret, sana y salva, en la galería. Aunque ella no estaba muy complacida con la idea.
Nicholas was understandably upset by the news of his wife's abduction, even more so when I made him sign a confession of his guilt in exchange for her release.
Nicholas quedó comprensiblemente disgustado al oír las nuevas del secuestro de su mujer. Y aún más cuando le hice firmar una confesión de culpabilidad a cambio de su liberación.
I have to find Nicholas and force him to sign the confession.
Tengo que encontrar a Nicholas y obligarle a firmar a confesión.
Now I just have to take the document back to Hanekin Hare.
Ahora solo tengo que llevarle el documento a Liebre Hanekin.
I told Margaret to hang that garland on the lodge as a signal to Hanekin Hare. But instead of his beloved Margaret, he'll be meeting me there!
Le he dicho a Margaret que cuelgue la guirnalda como señal para Liebre Hanekin. Pero en lugar de con Margaret, se va a reunir conmigo.
I'll have to ask around if anyone knows more about this Limpy Lubosh. Maybe I'll learn something useful.
Tendré que preguntar a ver si alguien me puede decir más sobre este Lubosh el Renco. Quizá descubra algo útil.
